title: How do we know that NO3 is nitrate and not nitrite? - Quora

response.answer_text: Always the highest oxide of that group element ends with (-ite). For example- sulphur its with 4 oxygen (SO4)-2. Sulphate (PO4)-2. Phosphate (SiO4)-4 silicate But in nitrogen due to absence of vaccant orbitals, its cannot expand its octet. Due to dis reason also PCl5 exists but NCl5 does not. In chlorine family, has different nomenclature. ClO3- is chlorate. ClO4- is perchlorate. Hope its clear!!
